page.title: 11Nether Stowey: Schools
page.content: The main centre for education in this area is the new Nether Stowey VC Primary School, opened in 1979. It offers educational facilities for children between the ages of 4 - 11 years. On roll are 186 children, mostly from the village, but a few come from the outlying communities. A mini-bus collects pupils from Over Stowey, whose own school amalgamated with this in 1979. Teaching staff consists of Head and seven full time class teachers, aided by two part time classroom assistants. School meals are cooked on the premises, although at least half of the children bring packed lunches.Dental treatment, eye and hearing tests, and speech therapy are available. Pre-school children attend playgroup at the village hall.For secondary education most pupils transfer to Bridgwater schools.
